stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Necurs Malware and C2 Identified from Financial Sector Incident
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 27 August 2014, the Necurs malware (MD5: 0adc60d78faf35c8bd044ff562e6168a) was observed in an incident against a financial organization. The malware beacons to IP 128.199.176.195 every minute.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
According to the data source, the Necurs malware includes the following capabilities:
- VM Aware - Anti-debugger - Hooks in SSDT - Unloads common analysis tool drivers - Monitors registry activity - Can download additional malware
This file creates the following registry key to enable persistence: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\service\syshost32: C:\Windows\Installer\{GUID}\syshost.exe /service
The file copies itself to: C:\windows\installer\{GUID}\syshost.exe
It creates a service: C:\windows\installer\{GUID}\syshost.exe /service

After successful check-in over UDP, the Necurs malware communicates with the received IP over http and sends a HTTP POST request to http://128.199.176.195/forum/db.php. It communicates with the server every minute.
The Necurs malware alters the local firewall rules table with netsh.exe. It also queries a domain generation algorithm (DGA) domain list and communicates via UDP over ports 10000-30000.
